ratings.comment: His lectures are outstanding! However, his in office personality could use a bit of work. He holds high expectations and if you don't meet those expectations, he has a tendency to turn condescending and nasty. The same personality trait holds when asking for help. If your question is a little basic, he gets fairly annoyed fairly fast.

Awesome professor. Explains everything very well and expectations are made clear. Problem sets almost every week, but they're not too bad and are helpful for the exams. Exams aren't too bad if you study the problem sets and derivations. I suck at math, but I really enjoyed this class and Mahanthappa is a really cool guy. I definitely recommend him!

Could be the best professor I've ever had. Very passionate about the material, explains it very well. Lectures are very interesting, keeps you engaged. Does a great job of supplementing lectures with demonstrations.
Amazing professor. Chem 109 is hard and can be overwhelming, but Mahesh explains the material very well. Would have done much worse had i had another professor for 109

Fantastic professor. Like everyone said before, a little more effort than you'd expect should be sufficient for an A. I had class w/ him over 2 years ago, and studying for my MCAT right now, I feel extremely prepared and remember more than I thought I would thanks to his detailed course. It moves fast, but it's worth it.
Great professor. Very clear and to the point. His exams are fairly difficult but there is usually a curve. Amusing  because he does demonstrations every lecture. Take him for Chem 109

Mahanthappa is a sweet-ass professor.  He's teaches really clearly, and knows his chemistry.  His class is hard, but the material is worth it.  You only get like, 3 tries for the quizzes.  But, he likes to teach, and you can tell.  Definitely recommended!
great teacher. clear in teaching and really loves what he does. put in a little more effort than you initially think you may need and that should get you an A

Incredible professor for chemistry. His exams were pretty hard and his class took a lot of work, but he is worth it. He's charismatic and a genuine guy.  Once a month he seemed to pull off an incredible lecture that insightfully related chemistry to current issues.
Mahanthappa is amazing. He's enthusiastic and very knowledgable. His lectures are fast-paced with great demos. Tests are somewhat difficult.

Fantastic! Do anything you can to have him for a chem class! He is extremely knowledgeable and his lectures are very interesting and worth going to without a question. Yes, his class is challenging, but if you put it the effort it is manageable. Also, he is a lot of help and has a vested interest in students who put in the effort. Great guy!!

Best professor I've ever had! I always look forward to going to his lecture. He's enthusiastic, funny, dresses well, and cares a lot about his students. The class was still tough, but having him made everything so much better.

Prof Mahanthappa was a great professor all around. Despite Chem 109 being an advanced class, Mahanthappa's lectures were usually easy to follow, and his notes were great as well. The class isn't easy, but his exams are fair, and he gives you plenty of opportunities to boost your grade with homework and labs.
Great teacher but the midterms and final are extremely hard.
Simply put, an awesome professor.  Funny in lecture, helpful, available for questions and with e-mails.  Chem isn't my thing, but this professor made it alright. Take this man if you can.
he's a really good lecturer high energy and talks clearly i think he's one of the best profs i've had
LOVED HIM. Honestly best professor I've ever had!
Really great teacher.  Made the class as interesting as possible.  Fair exams.

A really good professor.  He was a lot of fun. Had a lot of cool demonstrations in class, to keep you interested in going.  Wrote his notes on the board but were pretty clear and easy to keep along with.

Easily the best professor I've ever had.  His lectures are exciting and fun to attend.  Not only are there many demos, but Mahesh gives off this aura of excitement and immense knowledge about chemistry.  The class is definitely a lot of work, but he is a very fair grader. Do your HW, put in effort on labs, and go to lecture: Recipe for an A

Best lecturer ever- no joke.  I went into the class intimidated by chemistry and came out loving it.  Always goes the extra mile to help students.  Classes are exciting with lots of explosive demos- all my other chem classes have seemed lame by comparison.

Professor Mahanthappa was an excellent professor. He is very passionate about what he teaches and it shows in his lecture. Best lecturer I've EVER had. He's very energetic and loves to do demonstrations to prove his point. Honestly, the course is VERY DIFFICULT, but having a good professor really helps. Get Professor Mahanthappa if you can.

Great professor.  Truly passionate about subject.  Speaks clearly.  HW weekly can be difficult at times but manageable.  Tests can be difficult, but if youre prepared manageable.  Great class great prof, would love to have him again.

Mahesh is truly a great teacher.  His charisma and passion for chemistry really makes the class go by quickly.  The content of this course is very difficult, but he makes it interesting to listen to.  A strong background in Chemistry is highly recommended.

This man is inspiring. I like chem, but he really made it come to life with his dynamic teaching, which included demos and connections to the real world. He LOVES chemistry- and it's contagious. Tough class with stressful exams, but do the work and you'll make it. He is fair. HIGHLY recommend if you have a strong chem background. Get to know him!!!
Decent Professor, awesome demos, easy to understand. This is the toughest class I've ever taken, but 109 is meant to be intense. If you take 109, take it with him.

Mahanthappa loves experiments. He has a lot of energy and goes through everything really fast. While he is a fun professor, it sometimes seems like he's a bit full of himself. Also, he sometimes overestimates how well we understand what he's teaching. Overall though, it's a great class.
Mahesh is a really good teacher.  By far was my favorite professor and I didnt do well in the class.  Dont worry about failing it, he gives a sweet curve at the end of the year.

Mahesh is a really energetic guy.  You can typically find him sprinting up and down the stairs.  He loves polymers---so watch out for those on the exam.  He applies what we are learning to everyday life.  He is a very chatty guy and willing to help.  Overall awesome!
Energetic and enthusiastic really a good teacher and a nice guy
Awesome professor. I can't even imagine a more engaging and energetic professor. While that does mean the class moves extremely fast, he knows what he is talking about and the tests are 100% fair.

He is a very dynamic lecturer. He uses lots of demonstations and props. You can tell that he loves what he does, and he applies the material to real life. The tests are a bit challenging, but nothing you should expect from a 5 credit accelerated course. i highly recommend the class if you have some understanding of chemistry.

Hard class, but amazing professor. He posts all the resources you need online, so you can always find ways to improve your understanding of the material. Although the pace is fast, but he is very passionate and he makes everything interesting.

For such a tough course, Mahesh is a great guy. From the beginning he says that its going to be a tough semester and warns you that you will have to work hard. When I got mono, he was very supportive-- great guy. great teacher.

Great professor, really cares about making his kids interested in science.  Class will give you the best knowledge to take any science class at this school. Chem 109 is a lot of work, but not hard work, keep up and you'll get an A. They curved at the end as well, so don't freak about grades early on.

Great guy. Great demos. Great smile. It's a hard class, as it encompasses a wide range of topics very quickly. If you aren't a chemistry person, STRONGLY consider taking 103/104 route instead. He was the best lecturer of the 109 Profs.

This class was very difficult, especially if you only took one year of Chem in high school. Despite the fact that it is a total points grading system, most people get B's in the class because they do make adjustments. Final note: Mahanthappa's lecture's average score was the highest on every exam! He's a great professor.

He was a very animated teacher.  He had great demonstrations and was really interested in his teaching.  The class was obviously hard, but do the homework and labs thoroughly and you should do alright on the tests.

Difficult class, but about as good of a professor as you're going to get for Chemistry. Don't take this class if you did not take AP Chem in high school. If you've had no experience then you're just asking for a GPA ruiner. He was often very interesting to listen to and for a chem class, not too boring.

This is a difficult class.  He races through examples and makes no attempt to dumb them down.  Whether that is a good or a bad thing is up to you, just know that if you don't have a solid foundation in chemistry from AP Chem etc, then this class will be an up-hill battle for a b the whole semester. 103/104 moves much slower, much simpler.

Awesome Professor, very helpful, passionate about his subject (and especially polymers), you have to attend to do well, his lectures are very interesting and often funny, I used the book occasionally to elaborate on what he covered in lecture but was fine most of the time without it, good demos which often go awry in a humorous fashion

Makes lecture interesting.  He is very excited about his field and enthusiastic about sharing it with his students.  Provides many examples to help us learn chemistry and can also connect with his students and understand the college life.

Professor Mahanthappa is a great guy. He is very helpful and will go out of his way to help you understand difficult concepts or reschedule an exam due to conflicts. He is INTERESTING, which is particularly helpful, because lectures are key to doing well on exams. He's easy to listen to and easy on the eyes, as well! Overall a great professor.

He does a great job of capturing attention during lecure with demos each day. He makes the material very clear and allows for questions for greater clarity. He provides great review material for the exams. It is important to go to lecture because he will include some things that are not in the book.
He knows how to capture his audience... and keep them awake with interesting experiments! Tests are hard but homework is easy so it averages out nicely.

Great teacher, thought that a lot of people didn't really realize this...  but they will after they see some of the other professors around here. Overall layout of the class requires you to "chose" what you want to learn, you can decide if that's good or bad.

He was a really helpful teacher. I really enjoyed the class. He stumbled occasionally during lectures but what lecturers dont? Very enthusiastic about his topic. Offers a lot of options if you're having trouble.

He is a very good professor, it's just a hard course.  It will be a lot of work, and even more difficult if you did not take an advanced chemistry course in high school.  Great lecturer, and shows a genuine concern for the success of students in the class.  Use all the provided exam preparation materials.  The lab section is often very tedious.
His lectures are not boring, he likes blowing things up every so often, and he's very approachable if you need help.

OK guy. Very hard to stay awake in lecture sometimes. Lectures can be VERY fast but you HAVE to go to all the lectures..there is no way not to. Sit in the front! He'll get to know you which is good. Tests 1,3,Final are VERY hard. But dont be discouraged, they curve the grade at the end. If you dont need 109 i would suggest taing 103/104 EASIER
Lectures are worthless. He makes mistakes in lecture all the time. He leaves huge chemical devices on his desk so you cant even see the board. His handwriting can be very unreadable at times.

Good teacher overall. Has energy. Class is hard if you have never seen any of these concepts before. Lots of work, not all particually hard. Curve is generous on tests. Has some cool experiments as well.

Lectures=> very organized! start class reviewing what happened in the last lecture. He is very engaging/enthusiastic! Also, demos are frequent, like every lecture.TESTS-> practice tests helps. so does the list of things we need to know. You do have to do work for an A, as with any class. Not too bad. Attend lecure. Durr.
He's a good teacher.
his lectures arent particularly helpful, although he is a very enthusiastic teacher and communicates the eminence of chemistry well
He illuminates my chemistry's inclination. His experiments are all great. I feel like chemistry is not at all far from us. I used to hate chemistry, but now I've completely changed.
No Comments
No Comments
